text: Marco Greco (Born December 1, 1963 in São Paulo) is a Brazilian former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer and auto racing driver who competed in the Indy Racing League from 1996 to 1999. His best finish in the season points was third in 1996–1997. He made four starts in the Indianapolis 500 with a best finish of 14th in 1998. He previously competed in the CART World Series in full seasons in 1993 for Sovereign Motorsports and in 1994 for Arciero Racing and partial seasons in 1995 and 1996 for Dick Simon Racing, Galles Racing, and Team Scandia. ==Career results== === Career summary === {| class="wikitable" !Year !Series !Position |- |1987 |British Formula Three |NC |- |1988 |International Formula 3000 |NC |- | rowspan="2" |1989 |British Formula Three |4th |- |International Formula 3000 |NC |- |1990 |International Formula 3000 |NC |- |1992 |Indy Lights |7th |- | rowspan="2" |1993 |Indianapolis 500 |NC |- |IndyCar |30th |- | rowspan="2" |1994 |Indy Car |29th |- |Indianapolis 500 |27th |- | rowspan="2" |1995 |IndyCar |29th |- |Indianapolis 500 |NC |- | rowspan="3" |1996 |Indy Car |31st |- |1996 Indianapolis 500 |26th |- |Indy Racing League |36th |- |1996-1997 |Indy Racing League |style="background:#ffdf9f;"| 3rd |- |1997 |1997 Indianapolis 500 |16th |- | rowspan="2" |1998 |Indy Racing League |10th |- |1998 Indianapolis 500 |14th |- |1999 |Indy Racing League |36th |} ===Grand Prix motorcycle racing=== ====Races by year==== (key) (Races in bold indicate pole position, races in italics indicate fastest lap) {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !
